title: [BUG] model build-docker

labels.name: area/docker
labels.description: Docker use anywhere, such as MLprojects and MLmodels

body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)
for information on what types of issues we address. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

Please fill in this template and do not delete it unless you are sure your issue is outside its scope.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: no I'm using mnist example in your github
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Linux Ubuntu 18.04
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: source
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.6.0
- **Python version**: Python 3.7.4
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**:
- **Exact command to reproduce**:

### Describe the problem
Describe the problem clearly here. Include descriptions of the expected behavior and the actual behavior.

I'm simply trying to make a docker image for my trained model, first of all I'm running MLflow as a docker container and after training the model and saved the model I tried to build-docker the model from the MLflow container but I'm getting an error

### Code to reproduce issue
Provide a reproducible test case that is the bare minimum necessary to generate the problem.

```mlflow models build-docker -m "mlruns/0/57dce2b2f09745e38c35934040433d90/artifacts/modelss" -n "test"```


### Other info / logs
Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks,
please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached.
```
2020/02/26 16:36:56 INFO mlflow.models.cli: Selected backend for flavor 'python_function'
2020/02/26 16:36:56 INFO mlflow.models.docker_utils: Building docker image with name test
/tmp/tmpn97f2_1n/
/tmp/tmpn97f2_1n/model_dir
/tmp/tmpn97f2_1n/model_dir/modelss
/tmp/tmpn97f2_1n/model_dir/modelss/MLmodel
/tmp/tmpn97f2_1n/model_dir/modelss/data
/tmp/tmpn97f2_1n/model_dir/modelss/data/pickle_module_info.txt
/tmp/tmpn97f2_1n/model_dir/modelss/data/model.pth
/tmp/tmpn97f2_1n/model_dir/modelss/conda.yaml
/tmp/tmpn97f2_1n/Dockerfile
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/conda/bin/mlflow", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(cli())
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 764, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 717, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1137, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1137, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 956, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 555, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/models/cli.py", line 153, in build_docker
    install_mlflow=install_mlflow)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/backend.py", line 140, in build_image
    entrypoint=pyfunc_entrypoint,
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/models/docker_utils.py", line 110, in _build_image
    universal_newlines=True)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 775, in __init__
    restore_signals, start_new_session)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 1522, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception_type(errno_num, err_msg, err_filename)
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'docker': 'docker'
```
